de.lmu.dbs.jforest.sampler
Class Sampler<T extends Dataset>

java.lang.Object
  de.lmu.dbs.jforest.sampler.Sampler<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BootstrapSampler
public abstract class Sampler<T extends Dataset>
extends java.lang.Object

Generic base class for implementing sampling algorithms.

Author:
Thomas Weber

split

public java.util.List<Sampler<T>> split(int parts)
Returns (parts) new Samplers that contain the disjunct split of the dataset pool. Each new Sampler contains the same amount of data (if division is not even, the last sampler actually has less than the others).

The samples for each Sampler are picked randomly from the dataset list. If parts is higher than the samplers size, the result will be the same as if parts were equal to the data pool size, meaning that for each dataset a new sampler is returned, which holds this single dataset.

Parameters:
parts - number of split samplers to be created
Returns:
